009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
012import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
013import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
014import java.lang.annotation.Target;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
020import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
021
022/**
023 * Utility methods and annotations related to ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog} class.
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/09/14 transfered annotations and dialog-related methods from {@link ParameterBundle}
027 */
028public abstract class DialogUtils {
029        
030        /**
031         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' (value) to be shown for following
032         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
033         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
034         */
035        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
036        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
037        public static @interface DialogLabel {
038                public String value();
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * Annotation to specify the number of digits (value) displayed when showing
043         * numeric values in dialogs.
044         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
045         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
046         */
047        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
048        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
049        public static @interface DialogDigits {
050                public int value();
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Annotation to specify the number of "columns" (value) displayed when showing
055         * string items in dialogs.
056         * This annotation has no effect on non-string fields.
057         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
058         */
059        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
060        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
061        public static @interface DialogStringColumns {
062                public int value();
063        }
064
065
066        /**
067         * Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
068         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
069         */
070        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
071        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
072        public static @interface DialogHide {
073        }
074
075        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
076
077        private DialogUtils() {}
078        
079        /**
080         * Creates a HTML string by formatting the supplied strings
081         * as individual text lines separated by {@literal <br>}.
082         * The complete text is wrapped by {@literal <html>...</html>}.
083         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addHelp(String)}.
084         * 
085         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
086         * @return a HTML string
087         */
088        public static String makeHtmlString(CharSequence... lines) {
089                return "<html>\n" + String.join("<br>\n", lines) + "\n</html>";
090        }
091        
092        /**
093         * Creates a string by formatting the supplied strings
094         * as individual text lines separated by newline.
095         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addMessage(String)}.
096         * 
097         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
098         * @return a newline-separated string
099         */
100        public static String makeLineSeparatedString(CharSequence... lines) {
101                return String.join("\n", lines);
102        }
103        
104        // ------------ Methods related to ParameterBundle  ------------------
105        
106        static Field[] getDialogFields(ParameterBundle params) {
107                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
108                List<Field> dialogFields = new ArrayList<>();
109                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
110                        if (isValidDialogField(f)) {
111                                dialogFields.add(f);
112                        }
113                }
114                return dialogFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Adds all qualified fields of the given {@link ParameterBundle} to the specified
119         * {@link GenericDialog} instance, in the exact order of their definition.
120         * Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no 
121         * {@link DialogUtils.DialogHide} annotation is present.
122         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code long}, {@code float},
123         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
124         * 
125         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
126         * @param gd a generic dialog
127         */
128        public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
129                Field[] dialogFields = getDialogFields(params);         // gets only public fields
130                for (Field f : dialogFields) {
131                        try {
132                                addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
133                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
134                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
135                        }
136                }
137        }
138        
139//      public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
140//              Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
141//              Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
142//              for (Field f : fields) {
143//                      if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogHide.class)) {
144//                              continue;
145//                      }
146//                      try {
147//                              addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
148//                      } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
149//                              throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
150//                      }
151//              }
152//      }
153        
154        /**
155         * Retrieves the field values of the specified {@link ParameterBundle} from
156         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
157         * The {@link ParameterBundle} is modified. 
158         * Throws an exception if anything goes wrong.
159         * 
160         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
161         * @param gd a generic dialog
162         * @return true if successful
163         */
164        public static boolean getFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
165                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
166                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
167                int errorCount = 0;
168                for (Field f : fields) {
169                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogHide.class)) {
170                                continue;
171                        }
172                        try {
173                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(params, f, gd)) {
174                                        errorCount++;
175                                }
176                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
177                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage()); // TODO: refine exception handling!
178                        }
179                }
180                return (errorCount == 0);
181        }
182        
183        /**
184         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
185         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
186         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item
187         * unless a {@link DialogLabel} annotation is present.
188         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code float},
189         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
190         * 
191         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
192         * @param field some field
193         * @param dialog the dialog
194         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
195         */
196        private static void addFieldToDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
197                        throws IllegalAccessException {
198                
199                String name = field.getName();
200                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
201                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
202                }
203                
204                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
205                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
206                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
207                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
208                }
209                
210                int stringColumns = 8;
211                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogStringColumns.class)) {
212                        stringColumns = 
213                                        Math.max(stringColumns, field.getAnnotation(DialogStringColumns.class).value());
214                }
215                
216                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
217                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
218                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(params));
219                }
220                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
221                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(params), 0);
222                }
223                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
224                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getLong(params), 0);
225                }
226                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
227                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(params), digits);
228                }
229                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
230                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(params), digits);
231                }
232                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
233                        String str = (String) field.get(params);
234                        dialog.addStringField(name, str, stringColumns);
235                }
236                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
237                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(params));
238                }
239                else {
240                        // ignore this field
241                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
242                }
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
247         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
248         * 
249         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
250         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
251         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
252         * @return true if successful
253         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
254         */
255        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
256        private static boolean getFieldFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog gd)
257                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
258                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
259                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
260                        field.setBoolean(params, gd.getNextBoolean());
261                }
262                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
263                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
264                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
265                                return false;
266                        }
267                        field.setInt(params, (int) val);
268                }
269                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
270                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
271                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
272                                return false;
273                        }
274                        field.setLong(params, (long) val);
275                }
276                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
277                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
278                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
279                                return false;
280                        }
281                        field.setFloat(params, (float) val);
282                }
283                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
284                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
285                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
286                                return false;
287                        }
288                        field.setDouble(params, val);
289                }
290                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
291                        String str = gd.getNextString();
292                        if (str == null) {
293                                return false;
294                        }
295                        field.set(params, str);
296                }
297                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
298                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
299                        if (en == null) {
300                                return false;
301                        }
302                        field.set(params, en);
303//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
304//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
305                }
306                else {
307                        // ignore this field
308                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
309                }
310                return true;
311        }
312        
313        private static boolean isValidDialogField(Field f) {
314                if (!ParameterBundle.isValidParameterItem(f)) {
315                        return false;
316                }
317//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
318//              if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
319//                      return false;
320//              }
321                // accept only certain field types in dialogs:
322                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
323                return (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || 
324                                clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
325                                clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum());
326        }
327
328
